alert.note: Alert for Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:53PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Liberty, southwestern Hill and north central Chouteau Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over southeastern Liberty and southwestern Hill Counties, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Joplin, Inverness, Rudyard and Kenilworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
